channel.title: Some Photography
channel.description:
Here's a few I shot from our trip to Louisiana. There's even more on my newest site update. They're a little big to show here.
It's pretty much typical up-close-and-personal photography. They were all shot with my Cosina Macro 100/3.5, with the exception of the ones of the boy (my cousin's son), which were shot with my Minolta 50/1.4. And they were all either wide open (3.5/1.4) or stopped down (4/1.7), so the DOF is very limited.
[img width=1280]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/dsc06856.jpg[/img] [img width=1280]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/dsc06934.jpg[/img] [img width=1280]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/dsc06931.jpg[/img] [img width=1280]http://somethingtohide.info/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/dsc06900.jpg[/img]
PS: haha I just this noticed on the third picture here. Near the bottom right there's area that's in focus like the flowers to the left. The little flower that's one of a kind in that picture. My new favorite part. I didn't even realize that much was in focus.
PPS: I just shrunk them for you guys on lower rez. They're all 1800x1200 photos for 4x6 printing, sized down from about 4Kx4K. Now these are 1280 wide.

item.title: Some Photography
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:7, topic:272564”][quote author=OnlyOneRule link=topic=359823.msg2747266#msg2747266 date=1239705293]
What camera are you using?
[/quote]
The First one was shot using a Minolta 50/1.4
The rest with a Cosina Macro 100/3.5
l2read

These pictures are really nice, The definition on that Lizards eye is Epic!
My only critisim is how the small childs ear is out of focus which doesnt look good.[/quote]

That’s not the camera used…
I used my old Sony a100.

Little boy’s ear couldn’t have been more in focus unless I stopped the aperture down a LOT more, which I didn’t because that would shoot the ISO past 800 introducing tons of noise or the shutter down to about 1". Then there’s not really a picture anymore.

You just have to come to love small DOF portraits. I have.

Read full topic

On another topic

What camera are you using?

The First one was shot using a Minolta 50/1.4
The rest with a Cosina Macro 100/3.5
l2read Maybe not

These pictures are really nice, The definition on that Lizards eye is Epic!
My only critisim is how the small childs ear is out of focus which doesnt look good.

item.title: Some Photography
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

In which ones O_o

Although I boosted the “vividness”, I lowered the saturation a little. It’s what I do to all of my pictures. My signature if you may.

#2 is not my desktop background
